alert.note: Alert for Kent; Montcalm; Newaygo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Michigan, southwest Michigan and west central Michigan, including the following counties, in central Michigan, Montcalm. In southwest Michigan, Kent. In west central Michigan, Newaygo. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain, with totals between 2 and 3 inches over the last several hours. Some localized rain totals of 4 inches may have occured. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Travelers should be extra cautious at night, when it is harder to see flooded areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
